content:
The Dramatists Guild of America (DGA) National Conference is a fantastic event for playwrights, composers, lyricists, and librettists to connect with industry professionals, learn about the business of playwriting, and get their work seen and heard.

**DGA National Conference Details:**

* **When:** August 14-16, 2023
* **Where:** New York City, NY (exact location TBD)
* **Description:** A three-day conference featuring panels, workshops, and networking opportunities with playwrights, agents, producers, and other industry professionals.

**Conference Programming:**

The conference will include a range of programming, such as:

* **Panels and Workshops:** Discussions on topics like playwriting craft, industry trends, and business skills, led by industry professionals.
* **Master Classes:** In-depth sessions with established playwrights, composers, and lyricists, focusing on their creative processes and experiences.
* **Networking Opportunities:** Meet and greet with fellow playwrights, agents, producers, and other industry professionals during social events and receptions.
* **Pitch Sessions:** Opportunities to pitch your work to industry professionals, including agents, producers, and literary managers.

**Registration:**

To register for the DGA National Conference, follow these steps:

1. **Check the DGA Website:** Visit the Dramatists Guild of America website ([www.dramatistsguild.com](http://www.dramatistsguild.com)) for conference updates and registration information.
2. **Member Discount:** If you're a DGA member, you'll receive a discounted registration rate. Consider joining the DGA or renewing your membership to take advantage of this benefit.
3. **Registration Fees:** Early bird rates will be available until a certain date, after which prices will increase. Be sure to check the website for the most up-to-date pricing information.
4. **Register Online:** Once registration opens, you'll be able to sign up online through the DGA website.

**Tips for Attending the DGA National Conference:**

1. **Plan Ahead:** Book your travel and accommodations early to ensure availability and affordability.
2. **Prepare Your Materials:** Bring business cards, headshots, and copies of your work (if applicable) to share with industry professionals.
3. **Network Strategically:** Research attendees and plan your networking approach to maximize your time and connections.
4. **Be Open to Feedback:** Attend panels and workshops with an open mind, and be prepared to learn from industry professionals and your peers.

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask.
